Animals:
Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!
Why do cows have hooves instead of feet? Because they lactose!
What do you call a fish with no eyes? Fsh.
Why did the scarecrow win an award? Because he was outstanding in his field!
What do you call a bear with no teeth? A gummy bear!
Why did the chicken join a band? Because it had the drumsticks!
Why don’t elephants use computers? Because they’re afraid of the mouse.
What do you call an alligator in a vest? An investigator.
Why do ducks have feathers? To cover their butt quacks!
Why did the cow cross the road? To get to the udder side!
How do you catch a squirrel? Climb up a tree and act like a nut!
Why don’t seagulls fly over the bay? Because then they’d be bagels!
What do you get when you cross a snowman and a vampire? Frostbite.
Why did the fish blush? Because it saw the ocean’s bottom.
How does a penguin build its house? Igloos it together!
Why was the cat sitting on the computer? To keep an eye on the mouse!

Lawyer:
What’s the difference between a lawyer and a herd of buffalo? The lawyer charges more.
Why don’t sharks attack lawyers? Professional courtesy.
How does an attorney sleep? First, he lies on one side, then he lies on the other.
What's the difference between a lawyer and a vulture? Lawyers accumulate frequent flyer miles.
What's black and brown and looks good on a lawyer? A Doberman.
What's the difference between a lawyer and a vulture? Lawyers accumulate frequent flyer miles.
How many lawyers does it take to change a light bulb? How many can you afford?
Why did God make snakes just before lawyers? To practice.
What do honest lawyers and UFOs have in common? You always hear about them, but you never see them.
What’s the difference between a lawyer and a trampoline? You take off your shoes to jump on a trampoline.
What do you call 5000 dead lawyers at the bottom of the ocean? A good start.
What’s the difference between a lawyer and a boxing referee? A boxing referee doesn’t get paid more for a longer fight.
Why are lawyers like nuclear weapons? If one side has one, the other side has to get one.
How can you tell if a lawyer is lying? Other lawyers look interested.
What's the difference between a lawyer and a herd of buffalo? The lawyer charges more.

Doctor:
Why did the doctor carry a red pen? In case they needed to draw blood.
I told my doctor I broke my arm in two places. He told me to stop going to those places.
Why did the doctor join the army? He wanted to be a general practitioner.
Why did the doctor go to the art museum? Because he wanted to get a little culture!
What did the doctor say to the rocket ship? Time to get your booster shot!
Why did the doctor laugh? Because he had a sense of tumor.
What do you call a doctor who fixes websites? A URLologist.
Why did the doctor sit in the red ink? He wanted to draw blood.
How do you know when a doctor is mad? He runs out of patients.
Why did the doctor become a gardener? Because he wanted to take care of his thistle practice.
What do you get when you cross a doctor with a dog? A vet-eranarian.
What did the doctor give to the sick lemon? Lemon-aid.
Why did the doctor go to the party? To get a little vitamin C!
What did the doctor prescribe to the angry balloon? A little helium.
What do you call a musical doctor? A medley-cal professional.

Teacher:
Why did the teacher wear sunglasses? Because her students were so bright!
Why was the math book sad? It had too many problems.
Why did the teacher write on the window? To make her lessons very clear.
Why did the student eat his homework? Because the teacher told him it was a piece of cake!
Why did the teacher go to the beach? To test the water.
What did the student say to the teacher after missing school? I’m sorry, I’m a bit behind in my work.
Why don’t teachers tell secrets on farms? Because the potatoes have eyes and the corn has ears.
Why did the teacher go to jail? Because she got caught robbing the knowledge bank.
What did the pencil say to the paper? I dot my I’s on you!
Why did the teacher always carry a pencil? In case she needed to draw attention to something.
Why don’t teachers like to break the rules? Because they always want to set a good example.
Why was the teacher always calm? Because she had all the class.
Why did the student throw a clock out the window? Because he wanted to see time fly.
Why did the music teacher need a ladder? To reach the high notes.
Why did the teacher bring a ladder to school? To reach the high notes.

Technology:
Why was the computer cold? It left its Windows open!
Why did the computer go to the doctor? Because it had a virus.
Why was the smartphone wearing glasses? It lost its contacts.
What do you call a computer superhero? A Screen Saver.
Why did the computer go to art school? To become a pixel artist.
Why did the internet break up with the Wi-Fi? It found a better connection.
Why don’t robots ever get lost? Because they have Google Maps installed.
Why was the computer tired when it got home? Because it had a hard drive.
Why did the smartphone need glasses? It lost all its contacts.
Why don’t computers take vacations? They’re already on the internet.
Why was the computer so angry? Because it had a byte!
Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because the light attracts bugs.
What’s a computer’s favorite snack? Microchips.
Why did the computer keep sneezing? It had a virus.
What do you call a computer that sings? A Dell.

Programming:
Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs!
How many programmers does it take to change a light bulb? None, that’s a hardware problem.
Why do Java developers wear glasses? Because they don’t C#.
What is a programmer’s favorite hangout place? Foo Bar.
Why do programmers hate nature? It has too many bugs.
What do you call a programmer from Finland? Nerdic.
Why did the programmer quit his job? Because he didn’t get arrays.
Why do programmers always mix up Christmas and Halloween? Because Oct 31 == Dec 25.
Why did the programmer go broke? Because he used up all his cache.
Why do programmers prefer iOS development? Because they don’t like Windows.
How do you comfort a JavaScript bug? You console it.
Why do programmers prefer using the dark mode? Because bugs are attracted to light.
Why was the programmer’s computer cold? It left Windows open.
Why do programmers love coffee? Because it’s code-brewing!
What’s a programmer’s favorite place to hang out? The Foo Bar.

Food:
Why did the tomato turn red? Because it saw the salad dressing!
What do you call fake spaghetti? An impasta.
Why don’t eggs tell jokes? Because they might crack up.
Why was the cookie sad? Because its mom was a wafer too long.
Why did the scarecrow become a successful neurosurgeon? Because he was outstanding in his field!
What did the baby corn say to the mama corn? Where’s popcorn?
Why don’t watermelons get married? Because they cantaloupe.
What do you call cheese that isn’t yours? Nacho cheese.
Why was the mushroom invited to the party? Because he’s a fungi!
Why did the orange stop? Because it ran out of juice.
Why don’t bananas snore? Because they don’t want to wake up the rest of the bunch.
What’s orange and sounds like a parrot? A carrot.
Why did the bread go to therapy? It couldn’t stop loafing around.
What do you call a sad strawberry? A blueberry.
Why do fish never do well in school? Because they’re always swimming below sea level.

Sports:
Why did the football player go to the bank? To get his quarterback.
Why was the basketball team so good at math? They knew how to count on each other.
Why did the golfer bring two pairs of pants? In case he got a hole in one.
Why was the stadium so cool? It was filled with fans.
Why did the baseball team hire a carpenter? To fix their broken bats.
Why do tennis players never get married? Because love means nothing to them.
Why do soccer players do well in school? Because they know how to use their heads.
Why don’t basketball players go on vacation? They would get called for traveling.
Why did the baseball player bring a rope to the game? In case he needed to tie the score.
Why are football stadiums always cool? Because they’re filled with fans.
Why did the runner quit the race? Because he couldn’t handle the pace.
Why do golfers carry extra shirts? In case they get a hole in one.
Why are baseball players bad at being cops? They always balk at the suspects.
Why don’t soccer players use the internet? They can’t seem to find the net.
Why did the soccer player go to the bank? To get his goalie amount of money.

Math:
Why was the equal sign so humble? Because it knew it wasn’t less than or greater than anyone else.
Why was the math book sad? It had too many problems.
Why do plants hate math? It gives them square roots.
Why don’t you do arithmetic in the jungle? Because if you add 4 and 4, you get ate.
Why was the obtuse angle so sad? Because it wasn’t right.
Why was the fraction worried about marrying the decimal? Because he would have to convert.
Why did the student do multiplication problems on the floor? The teacher told him not to use tables.
Why did the two 4s skip lunch? They already eight.
Why was six afraid of seven? Because seven eight nine.
Why did the student eat his math homework? Because the teacher told him it was a piece of cake!
Why was the geometry book so cute? Because it had acute angles.
Why was the number six so scared? Because seven eight nine.
Why do mathematicians love parks? Because of all the natural logs.
Why was the number seven so popular? Because seven eight nine.
Why was the obtuse angle always sad? Because it wasn’t right.

Science:
Why don’t scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!
What do you call an educated tube? A graduated cylinder.
Why was the biology book so worried? It couldn’t stop fission.
Why was the physics book so happy? It had potential energy.
Why did the scientist go to art school? To draw his conclusions.
Why did the photon check a bag? It was traveling light.
Why are chemists excellent for solving problems? They have all the solutions.
Why did the biologist look forward to casual Fridays? He was a jeans enthusiast.
Why was the chemistry teacher good at solving problems? Because he had all the solutions.
Why was the cell so good at math? It could multiply.
Why did the physics teacher break up with the biology teacher? There was no chemistry.
Why do plants hate math? Because it gives them square roots.
Why was the neutron unhappy? It felt neutral about everything.
Why do scientists love nitrates? They’re cheaper than day rates.
Why don’t physicists trust atoms? Because they make up everything.

Office:
Why did the scarecrow become a successful neurosurgeon? Because he was outstanding in his field!
Why was the computer cold? It left its Windows open!
Why did the employee bring a ladder to work? To reach the high notes.
Why did the office worker stay late? Because she had a lot of typing to do.
Why don’t secretaries play hide and seek? Because good luck hiding from a typewriter.
Why was the office so hot? Because all the fans were on vacation.
Why did the office worker wear a jacket? Because it was a cool job.
Why did the stapler feel important? Because it was holding everything together.
Why did the office worker go to therapy? Because he couldn’t stop pushing paper.
Why did the employee get fired from the orange juice factory? He couldn’t concentrate.
Why was the computer tired when it got home? Because it had a hard drive.
Why do office workers never get lost? They always follow the file path.
Why did the paperclip blush? Because it saw the folder’s bottom.
Why don’t secretaries tell secrets? Because they’re always typed.
Why was the printer always calm? Because it had all the ink.

Holiday:
Why was the math book so excited for Christmas? It had a lot of presents.
Why was the turkey at the Thanksgiving table? Because it was stuffed.
Why did the skeleton go to the party alone? Because it had no body to go with.
Why don’t mummies take vacations? They’re afraid they’ll relax and unwind.
Why did the Easter egg hide? It was a little chicken.
Why was the Christmas tree so bad at knitting? It kept dropping its needles.
Why did the scarecrow win an award? Because he was outstanding in his field!
Why did the elf go to school? To learn his elf-abet.
Why did the witch go to school? She wanted to learn how to spell.
Why did the turkey join the band? Because it had the drumsticks.
Why did the Easter bunny stay in bed? It was having a bad hare day.
Why do ghosts love elevators? It lifts their spirits.
Why did the vampire read the newspaper? He heard it was full of bloodcurdling stories.
Why did the turkey sit on the pumpkin pie? It wanted to hatch a dessert.
Why was the jack-o'-lantern so smart? Because it had a bright idea.
